snippet.textDisplay: This artwork of Satorl Marsh is so beautiful. This is one of the few areas in Xenoblade Chronicles where I like the night theme more than the day theme. When I saw Satorl Marsh at night for the first time, I was just amazed at how beautiful the atmosphere and music was, especially the glowing trees and the fog on the lower parts.
snippet.textOriginal: This artwork of Satorl Marsh is so beautiful. This is one of the few areas in Xenoblade Chronicles where I like the night theme more than the day theme. When I saw Satorl Marsh at night for the first time, I was just amazed at how beautiful the atmosphere and music was, especially the glowing trees and the fog on the lower parts.

snippet.textDisplay:
2:04 - 
Lyrics:
"He's still a tuna. 
He's still tuna. 
He's still all a saw.
He's still a tuna.
He's still tuneless saw"

Such wonderful lyrics to this beautifully written song.
snippet.textOriginal:
2:04 - 
Lyrics:
"He's still a tuna. 
He's still tuna. 
He's still all a saw.

snippet.textDisplay: @B-Bum hope we will get the official lyrics when the game is released, yet the fan translations are nearly true.
snippet.textOriginal: @B-Bum hope we will get the official lyrics when the game is released, yet the fan translations are nearly true.

snippet.textDisplay: I mean we don't have an official translation/interpretation of the lyrics, so anything we try to predict about them is in the realm of the theoretical.
snippet.textOriginal: I mean we don't have an official translation/interpretation of the lyrics, so anything we try to predict about them is in the realm of the theoretical.

snippet.textDisplay: @B-Bum I don't think that's a theory, considering everything that happens in the game.
snippet.textOriginal: @B-Bum I don't think that's a theory, considering everything that happens in the game.

snippet.textDisplay: @Ray Bois A better translation would be "consumed", likely referring to how the marsh has been "consumed" by darkness, or my personal theory, how the Bionis has been "consumed" by Zanza.
snippet.textOriginal: @Ray Bois A better translation would be "consumed", likely referring to how the marsh has been "consumed" by darkness, or my personal theory, how the Bionis has been "consumed" by Zanza.

snippet.textDisplay:
Bruh, you can't come here the first time in day after you beat Xord, it's always night when you first come here. And besides, the enemies are too much for a level 20-30+  to handle at night the first time, so, sadly, the night is bad at that time.
It sucks that this theme only plays at night, but... eh... You can't have everything in this world.

snippet.textDisplay: This game was like a museum, you could see a lot of pretty glimering things, but you couldn't touch or interact with any of them. When I think of this game, I think of FF13, only that they replaced their hallways with larger backyards, but is essentially the same thing, run from point A to point B, with no interaction except monsters. Oh and the boring grinding and awful sidequests, sweet jesus.
snippet.textOriginal: This game was like a museum, you could see a lot of pretty glimering things, but you couldn't touch or interact with any of them. When I think of this game, I think of FF13, only that they replaced their hallways with larger backyards, but is essentially the same thing, run from point A to point B, with no interaction except monsters. Oh and the boring grinding and awful sidequests, sweet jesus.

snippet.textDisplay: @Lion heart As a person who's favorite game ever is Xenogears (next to Chrono Trigger), Xenoblade Chronicles is one of the most incredible games, not just JRPG's, I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing so please don't act elitist like you're super special and only the new generation can enjoy it. As an old school JRPG fan and veteran, I wholeheartedly disagree on your assessment and opinion. And seriously, you're comparing a JRPG to Fallout? Completely different style of games. Go play Fallout then. I just prefer this to that and I love Fallout.
snippet.textOriginal: @Lion heart As a person who's favorite game ever is Xenogears (next to Chrono Trigger), Xenoblade Chronicles is one of the most incredible games, not just JRPG's, I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing so please don't act elitist like you're super special and only the new generation can enjoy it. As an old school JRPG fan and veteran, I wholeheartedly disagree on your assessment and opinion. And seriously, you're comparing a JRPG to Fallout? Completely different style of games. Go play Fallout then. I just prefer this to that and I love Fallout.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Robbe D'Hondt if you really want to play it, but don't want to spend the money on a playstation 1 or 3, and you don't like piracy, then simply buy it on PSN, creating an account on PSN is free. The game should be about 10 bucks. Then, download the ISO on the internet and play it using an emulator. You would be playing it legally since you paid for it on PSN.

A piece of advice on Xenogears though: although the story is the best I've seen on any JRPG, the gameplay and pacing of the game are not really the best. Keeping this in mind you might just enjoy it better on youtube after all.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Robbe D'Hondt if you really want to play it, but don't want to spend the money on a playstation 1 or 3, and you don't like piracy, then simply buy it on PSN, creating an account on PSN is free. The game should be about 10 bucks. Then, download the ISO on the internet and play it using an emulator. You would be playing it legally since you paid for it on PSN.

A piece of advice on Xenogears though: although the story is the best I've seen on any JRPG, the gameplay and pacing of the game are not really the best. Keeping this in mind you might just enjoy it better on youtube after all.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Lion heart  The depth of the story was what really counted for me in Xenoblade though. The huge maps were just fulfilling an old children's dream of mine.
I do however also enjoy a lot of old RPGs, for instance Golden Sun (played the second one like 3 full times) or DBZ: Legacy of Goku 2 (my favorite) or others. Old school RPGs on the gameboy are my favourite :D
Because of all the good reviews I heard about Xenogears, I'll be sure to check it out if I have the time. Any good playthroughs you recommend?

snippet.textDisplay:
@Robbe D'Hondt Let me put it into different words. I was expecting Xenogears and I got an offline MMO.

I don't know if Takahashi and Soraya had help when they created their masterpiece, but I'm sure as hell they either lost their touch, or no longer work with the people that made their previous masterpiece what it was.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Robbe D'Hondt Let me put it into different words. I was expecting Xenogears and I got an offline MMO.

I don't know if Takahashi and Soraya had help when they created their masterpiece, but I'm sure as hell they either lost their touch, or no longer work with the people that made their previous masterpiece what it was.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Lion heart  I remember getting a LOT of experience when exploring, especially when finding secret areas. I have never seen more interaction with the environment in a game. A great example are the high entia shrines that are scattered throughout Bionis that give you great rewards. Or even the 4 beacons you had to activate in Agniratha.
I understand what you're trying to say. But it had to feel like you were actually walking on a titan, that was the purpose of the games huge map.
I have to give you credit on the sidequests though. The collection and hunting quests were annoying, but there were some pretty interesting quests from named NPCs.
snippet.textOriginal:
+Lion heart  I remember getting a LOT of experience when exploring, especially when finding secret areas. I have never seen more interaction with the environment in a game. A great example are the high entia shrines that are scattered throughout Bionis that give you great rewards. Or even the 4 beacons you had to activate in Agniratha.
I understand what you're trying to say. But it had to feel like you were actually walking on a titan, that was the purpose of the games huge map.
I have to give you credit on the sidequests though. The collection and hunting quests were annoying, but there were some pretty interesting quests from named NPCs.

snippet.textDisplay: This is one of the most beautiful areas I've ever seen in a video game. I was stunned when I first saw it and heard the music in great depth. Daytime Satorl Marsh is so lame compared to this! The colors of the night, and this incredible song, are just mesmerizing!
snippet.textOriginal: This is one of the most beautiful areas I've ever seen in a video game. I was stunned when I first saw it and heard the music in great depth. Daytime Satorl Marsh is so lame compared to this! The colors of the night, and this incredible song, are just mesmerizing!

snippet.textDisplay:
I think the day time Satorl Marsh makes the night even more beautiful. It's like a butterfly emerging from its chrysalis.

Edit: Oh, haha. I didn't realize I had already left some comments here four years ago. Man...time flies.

@Giygas_95 I'll never forget when I first saw it turn night.
I just froze. Very few games have come close to that reaction since.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Giygas_95 I'll never forget when I first saw it turn night.

snippet.textDisplay: +Maester Mike Honestly, I think that's what makes Satorl Marsh so mesmerizing.  During the day, it's this bland, colorless wetland with dull music playing in the background.  But at night, suddenly everything lights up, the music becomes really ethereal, and it's almost as if you're transported to somewhere else entirely.  It gives it this incredibly surreal quality.
snippet.textOriginal: +Maester Mike Honestly, I think that's what makes Satorl Marsh so mesmerizing.  During the day, it's this bland, colorless wetland with dull music playing in the background.  But at night, suddenly everything lights up, the music becomes really ethereal, and it's almost as if you're transported to somewhere else entirely.  It gives it this incredibly surreal quality.

snippet.textDisplay: Choose Xenoblade Chronicles. Not only is it a throw back to older RPGs, but also very fresh as well, and essentially I'd put it up there as my favorite game of this generation, and one of the best of all time. Insane replay value, and loads of hours(seriously, this thing is Skyrim on the Wii, I've got over 100+ hours and I still have yet to 100% the game, the story taking at least 50 of those hours)
snippet.textOriginal: Choose Xenoblade Chronicles. Not only is it a throw back to older RPGs, but also very fresh as well, and essentially I'd put it up there as my favorite game of this generation, and one of the best of all time. Insane replay value, and loads of hours(seriously, this thing is Skyrim on the Wii, I've got over 100+ hours and I still have yet to 100% the game, the story taking at least 50 of those hours)

snippet.textDisplay:
That's definitely a choice where you win and lose anyway ;D Win because both games are among the greatest of the last 10 years easily,lose because it will take lonbger before you play the other^^
Xenoblade has excellent music, story tellign and gameplay and you really need alot of time to complete it.
Nier is not as quite as long, but it has also brilliant music, great storytelling, and the fill you get as the player causing what happens in the game is just plain amazing, especially second time

snippet.textDisplay: Go for Xenoblade Chronicles. The music, characters, and storytelling are all excellent and hearken back to many of the great qualities of the golden era of RPGs. One of the best RPGs I've played in the past ten years, along with Lost Odyssey and Radiant Historia.
snippet.textOriginal: Go for Xenoblade Chronicles. The music, characters, and storytelling are all excellent and hearken back to many of the great qualities of the golden era of RPGs. One of the best RPGs I've played in the past ten years, along with Lost Odyssey and Radiant Historia.

snippet.textDisplay: My absolute favorite track from the entire game. And that's saying a lot since the entire soundtrack was excellent from start to finish. Satorl Marsh at night, however, is such a beautifully haunting melody that easily thrusts itself to the top of many lists.
